@mooshu1x2 Can you let me know if this pull request needs to be pulled. Looks like you merged, then re-opened pull requests. However, you committed new code directly to repos/branches in April. Can you ping me and let me know if I should resolve and merge or if my instincts are right?
Perfect! Thanks to you too ;)
@poorejc This PR can be deleted.
@mooshu1x2 Thanks so much! Saved me a lot of forensics. I hope you're well, mooshu. Miss ya!
@poorejc will close this PR request following migration to Gitbox--will be easier.
Doing this through Gitbox-enabled workflow
Updated
Done

Not that I am aware of @yogeshkodei 
@poorejc any ideas?

I met with @yogeshkodei about this on zoom. Donâ€™t have anything slated for this ATM. We are, however, happy to assist any developers who are interested in designing and building this apparatus. But, this is a very domain-specific use case for Flagon.

I will note that as of JUN 2021 we will begin building out a new version of distill, and we will be deploying some relevant analytics to training. More specifics on what @yogeshkodei is looking for would be welcome to see if it spurs any other ideas for analytics we can package with distill.

Thnx,

Josh

I don't know Flagon's conventions ...  What have we arrived at for when is OK to merge?  Even if a committer [ and innocuous change ] -- should I get a LGTM from a committer?

LGTM ðŸ˜„ 

Sorry for the slow response on this @brucearctor. I'd recommend making a PR for all changes to solicit community feedback. That said, on small changes like this you can use your best judgement

@UncleGedd -- I think I'll take that to dev list, so we have an archive of a discussion/resolution of when OK to merge.  We should formalize general community conventions.  Thinking ahead to potential community growth ;-)
Merged, but had to resolve some conflicts. Commit 0b26659 is at master now.
fixed with https://github.com/apache/incubator-flagon/commit/de92c6c08fa62293cbed6aab27c7b97276d19ec0

@yogeshkodei -- moving to the next level is not a decision the project can make, that is determined by the Apache Incubator.  The project can take steps towards that happening.  Why is moving to the next level important [ I assume you mean 'graduating' from the incubator ]?  

Also, yes, the community is doing more with Superset these days.
@yogeshkodei have you made much progress here?  Contributions welcome!

As a question would this be better for https://docs.github.com/en/discussions or on-list?  Is this an issue [ to me that means a potential to-do item ].  I don't understand how to mark this 'issue' complete.  But, we haven't yet established community practices around this.
@poorejc -- looks like you've started using Superset.  Can this issue be closed?  Or is there more 'exploration' to be done before this can be completed?
'as needed' -- is this a good scope for an issue?  When is it complete, if ever?
@poorejc can you comment on where/how our site is deployed?
My mistake! I was navigating to our site using HTTP rather than HTTPS. Closing this issue for now, but maybe we could configure whatever provider we use to always route to HTTPS

@UncleGedd yes!! This is definitely an issue in our post-TLP steps that we absolutely need to address. 

How the site works--see here: https://github.com/apache/flagon/tree/asf-site/site

BLUF--update source at MASTER, rebuild and copy files to /contents, then merge to ASF-SITE branch. Automation for publication is managed through the asf.yaml files in asf-site branch.

The site could use a major overhaul in the build (its so old). We can limp by updating files. I can try and help this weekend in updating the .md files which build into html.
Let's bump things
@brucearctor Thanks so much for this! Much needed. Let me test the build this week! So sorry for delay!
@poorejc -- what's our 'testing the build' process look like?  Seems something more ideal to be automated?
ugh... have been looking at this, but got new laptop and am in Ruby local/global hell. Gonna need to retreat for tonight and try again tomorrow after I reinstall ruby. I'm on this though.

Another time receiving...  or does this go where we want?

So, the last PR from a Dependabot on Master might be the culprit--I can't build your branch or master. I get the same error, which is related to a Ruby version collision. It says it expects v 2.6 and says I'm running 2.5, when I'm not and I don't have that installed on my new box or old. I can build the asf-branch, which is just 1 functional commit behind master. I'm guessing the last Gemfile dependency has some engine constraint in it that we need to address. I think I'll try and regress  that dependency and then try and merge your PR.

Culprit is either something in the public_suffix library or we have something coercing Ruby version to v 2.5 in the code and it's superceding my local and global settings for Ruby. I can get this branch to build if I regress Public_Suffix to 4.0.1. But just doesn't make sense--I'm guessing we have some weird setting that's set globally. Lame. I'll have to return to it later this weekend.
Bug is reproduceable on 'Master" and was introduced with commit:  https://github.com/apache/flagon/commit/0eded9e45f978f5a42af8ec00f278d298ad5c48e
A follow up could be introducing a test [ ex: via GH Actions ] to verify that future changes won't get merged and break ( at least in the same way ).

@Jyyjy 100 kill on this. Thanks for the extra effort here. Also big performance improvement on the server. Works well!

New network:
```
networks:
  esnet:
    name: esnet
    external: true
```

In every ELK service add:
```
logstash:
    user: "1000:0"
    ...
```

132 files changed :eyes: !

Are you trying to kill me?
Docker example works for me. I fixed a typo and added a `requirements.txt`. We also should improve the K8s example at some point to include a cleanup script at minimum... later.
Superseded by #50.
@Jyyjy -- why no review/approval from anyone else?

I made changes to the site and had a PR open for feedback for 3+ days, and I merged it based off lazy consensus. But in that PR I forget to copy my changes to /content to actually update the site, so I merged this one immediately to fix that  because I consider it a non-change. Is that okay?
@Jyyjy I can work on this issue. Can you brief me more and assign this issue to me?
@brucearctor I can work on this issue. Can you pls brief a bit more and assign this issue to me?
Yes, let me update the description. I think I created this issue for myself but never ended up completing it.

https://flagon.apache.org/docs/contributing/ <- there is always room for more contributing guidelines.

I imagine keep notes on your experiences making other contributions, write out what you needed to do for that to occur, and then you could distill that information to improve the docs to make contributions easier for people in the future.
Hey! @Jyyjy I have added the README file which contains the steps for setting up the project locally using docker.
@Jyyjy I have raised the PR. Pls review it and if everything is ok, kindly merge it.
